She had been lost, but now she'd found her path.%K%P
She'd even found a real place with my family,\nnot just using them as an escape like before.%K%P
The way she used to smile to hide her sadness\nhad faded away into a genuine smile.%K%P
After seeing her shine for real,\nI fell even more in love.%K%P
'Sorry for stealing your PC from you.'%K%P
She borrowed my laptop to work on her song.%K%P
'No, it's fine.\nBut in this case, you should just say thanks,\nnot sorry.'%K%P
'I guess you're right. Thank you, Yamato.'%K%P
'Want a thank you kiss?'%K%P
She was really good at drawing me in.%K%P
She was a goddess after all,\nbut even so, I wanted her to understand just\nwhat kind of effect she could have on others.%K%P
'Let's save that for when you're\na little less busy.'%K%P
'Thanks. That's one I.O.U. kiss, then!'%K%P
She said as she blew a kiss my way.%K%P
It meant I'd have to give it back later.%K%P
And so, I continued to watch her work,\nworrying endlessly over her.%K%P
'Though I just realized,\nyou're not using your guitar for this?'%K%P
'Of course I am.\nBut it doesn't really help it really stick.'%K%P
'It's only good for making melodies.\nWhen you just want to get all your ideas together,\nI think it's easier to do it on the computer.'%K%P
The whole time she'd been working on her song,\nshe hadn't brought her guitar here once.%K%P
And only she could hear what was on the PC.%K%P
'What's the matter? You want to know what I'm up to?'%K%P
'Well, I mean, yeah. It's a song about me after all.'%K%P
'Too bad! I can't show you this.'%K%P
'The end result is going to be for you.\nSo just wait until it's done, okay?'%K%P
She had the song locked away from me,\nbut I just sat there ready to help.%K%P
I couldn't really do anything but give her a space\nto work on it, but I was pleased with that.%K%P
'Still, it's kind of weird, right?'%K%P
'What do you mean...?'%K%P
'Didn't you know?\nBenzaiten is the goddess of music.\nSo usually people write songs FOR me.'%K%P
'But here I am, doing the exact opposite.'%K%P
'Wait, did I break some religious law\nby asking for this?'%K%P
'No, no. I'm kind of glad, really.'%K%P
She did truly look happy.%K%P
All songs have creators and receivers.\nEach side is different, but they have some things\nin common.%K%P
'You really love music.'%K%P
'Oh, absolutely.'%K%P
She really had a passion for it.%K%P
It was exactly why she fussed over her songs so much.%K%P
And it was the reason she seemed so intense.%K%P
Even if she could never sing again,\nshe was the goddess of music,\nand none would love music more than her.%K%P
'Heehee!'%K%P
'W-Why are you staring?'%K%P
'I'm just looking, is all.'%K%P
She said with a smile on her face.%K%P
'I just wanted to get a good look at you\nto see what I felt from it.'%K%P
'Because that's a crucial piece of my song.'%K%P
She stared at me a bit longer before turning back.%K%P
I just sat and watched her many expressions,\nand that was enough to make me happy, too.%K%P
